content: a3 b1 front of the leg and 33 37 sts on needle 2 until leg measures approximately 3-4 cm / 1½ i e the back of the leg inches less than the desired final length for the best result it s recommended to finish the work sts on needle 1 according to chart a1 stranded colourwork pattern after row 1 or b1 work sts on needle 2 according to chart 11 a3 b1 as follows k1 with the colour that is st 1 of chart a3 b1 for the same row as worked switch to smaller needles if desired knit one on needle 1 then k2tog with the colour that is round with mc one round with cc and one st 2 of chart a3 b1 for the same row and round with mc cut cc finally work chart a3 b1 sts 3-32 3-36 for the same row with mc work *ktbl p1* ribbing for 14 16 rnds or to desired cuff length bind off using any elastic bind-off method of your choice the sample socks have been bound off with sewn bind-off finishing soak the socks in lukewarm water remove excess water by rolling the socks in a towel let dry flat or on sock blockers weave in ends abbreviations cc contrast colour k knit kfb knit through front and back loop mc main colour m1l make 1 left m1r make 1 right p purl pfb purl through front and back loop p2tog purl 2 sts together chart key round s round s rs right side sl slip ssk slip slip knit st s stitch es ws wrong side w&t wrap and turn the emperor s bride socks page 3/7 chart a1 size s needle 1 instep chart a2 size s needle 2 sole the emperor s bride socks page 4/7 chart a1 size s needle 1 front of the leg chart a3 size s needle 2 back of the leg the emperor s bride socks page 5/7 chart b1 size m/l needle 1 i e instep in the foot both needles in the leg chart b2 size m/l needle 2 sole the emperor s bride socks page 6/7 chart c pin-striped gusset chart key size s the emperor s bride socks page 7/7
